meanings.definition: A small citrus fruit resembling a tangerine.
meanings.sent1: I picked a calamondin from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The calamondin was juicy and tangy.
meanings.sent3: The calamondin rolled off the table and surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as bright and refreshing as a calamondin.
meanings.sent5: The children's faces lit up when they tasted the calamondin.

meanings.sent1: The calamondin tree provided shade in the garden.
meanings.sent2: We planted a new calamondin next to the lemon tree.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels played hide-and-seek around the calamondin tree.
meanings.sent4: The branches of the calamondin tree reached towards the sky like outstretched arms.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the blossoming calamondin tree filled the air with sweetness.

meanings.definition: The tart juice of the calamondin fruit.
meanings.sent1: She squeezed the calamondin to extract its juice.
meanings.sent2: The calamondin juice added a zesty flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally mistook the calamondin juice for lemon in the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The calamondin juice danced on my taste buds with its sour notes.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of calamondin juice lingered in the kitchen after cooking.
